obj/api/Gfycat.GfyFormat.html.title: Enum GfyFormat
obj/api/Gfycat.GfyFormat.html.keywords: Enum GfyFormat Namespace :Gfycat Assembly :Gfycat.Net.dll Syntax public enum GfyFormat Fields Name Description Gif Not recommended for use since .gif files are typically large, lower color/quality, and may cause users to despair over long download times and high data usage. However, a large number of platforms support it. Restrictions: 14MB max size, unless originally uploaded as a gif. Max100pxWidth This GIF format was designed for use in Tango and other text messaging apps. Restrictions: 100px max width Max14mb This GIF format was designed for autoplay on Twitter. Restrictions: 14mb max size Max1mb This GIF format was designed for autoplay on WeChat. Restrictions: 1MB max size MiniMp4 Half the size of .mp4. Used in Gfycat Loops and other GIF keyboard apps. Restrictions: 360px width, 202px height Mjpg Higher quality than .mp4 at the expense of file size. MJPEG compression is simpler than other video formats meaning older decoders may support it. Restrictions: 640px width, 15fps framerate. MobileMp4 Recommended for mobile. Ensures a wide compatibility with various smartphones and is the most efficient file to access over a mobile network or WiFi connection. Restrictions: 320px max width, 10-30fps framerate. Mp4 Recommended for mobile. Ensures a wide compatibility with various smartphones and is the most efficient file to access over a mobile network or WiFi connection. Restrictions: 640px max width, 10-30fps framerate. ReverseMp4 Same as Mp4 and MobileMp4 but reversed. Restrictions: 640px max width, 10-30fps framerate. SizeRestricted This GIF format was designed for sharing on Facebook since its restrictions allow the GIF to be autoplayed within Facebook. Restrictions: 5mb max size, min 250px per side Small This GIF format was designed for autoplay on Tumblr. Restrictions: 2MB max size Thumb360 Source video is scaled and cropped to specific dimensions so that the entire area is filled with content. This format is used for the Gfycat frontpage thumbnails. Restrictions: 360px width, 202px height Webm WEBM is a video format created by Google specifically for internet streaming with slightly lower quality than MP4 but better compression. If a WEBM file is uploaded to Gfycat without any additional modifications, it will not be re-encoded. Restrictions: None. Webp Newer video format recommended by Google as a GIF replacement. Good decoding support on many Android devices. Restrictions: 520px max width, 10fps framerate.

obj/api/Gfycat.RetryMode.html.keywords: Enum RetryMode Specifies retry modes for requests in the event they fail for any particular reason Namespace :Gfycat Assembly :Gfycat.Net.dll Syntax [Flags] public enum RetryMode Fields Name Description AlwaysFail All responses don't retry AlwaysRetry Retries the request if it times out, if it has a bad gateway, and on the first 401 Retry502 In the event of 502 (Bad Gateway), the request is attempted again RetryFirst401 In the event of 401, this will refresh the access token if possible and retry the request. If that request fails, an exception is thrown RetryTimeouts In the event of a task timeout, the request is attempted again

index.html.title: Welcome to the documentation and samples for Gfycat.Net!
index.html.keywords: Welcome to the documentation and samples for Gfycat.Net! Gfycat.Net is an unofficial CLS compliant wrapper for the Gfycat API built with the .NET Standard v1.2 Here you will find samples, walkthroughs, and API documentation for the entire library including Gfycat.Analytics To get started with API documentation, just click the "API Documentation" tab at the top of the page. Or read some articles to get started.
